attributes.action: Reopen the maternity unit at Samuel Johnson Community Hospital
attributes.additional_details:
Accepting this proposal would help women access this vital service closer to home.

The maternity unit was available for mothers considered low-risk to give birth in, until the service was suspended in 2020. Antenatal and post-natal care continue to be provided in Lichfield, but women have to travel elsewhere to give birth.

This proposal would increase provision in an area with a rising population and free up capacity elsewhere, therefore it is in the best interests of mothers and the NHS.
attributes.background: Staffordshire and Stoke-on-Trent Integrated Health Board (ICB) should reopen the midwife-led maternity unit at Samuel Johnson Community Hospital in Lichfield. Currently, women in South-East Staffordshire and Derbyshire have to travel to sites much further away to access maternity care.
